snippet: The Guggenheim Museum receives a grant to determine the subject of the portrait on the canvas underneath Picasso’s “Woman Ironing.”
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Guggenheim Museum receives a grant to determine the subject of the portrait on the canvas underneath Picasso’s Woman Ironing; Getty Research Institute in Los Angeles buys a complete portfolio of 14 prints created around 1921 by Feininger, Klee and five other early masters of the Bauhaus; High Line Park in New York City hosts its first group art show.
lead_paragraph: The Guggenheim Museum receives a grant to determine the subject of the portrait on the canvas underneath Picasso’s “Woman Ironing.”

headline.seo: Learning the Identity of a Phantom Picasso Subject
headline.main: Cracking the Curious Case of Picasso’s Ghost Subject
headline.print_headline: Cracking the Curious Case Of Picasso’s Ghost Subject
